Author: logic_anarchy
Content:
@Tim 'mithro' Ansell @Leo Moser (mole99) 
It’s crazy — I started my gate-level simulation on **December 3rd**, and **18 days later**, today **December 21st**, I can finally see the first kernel messages… maybe in **two weeks** it’ll boot into the console.

Author: logic_anarchy
Content: This gate-level simulation runs against the Micron SDRAM model, so we’re simulating real SDRAM accesses.

Author: logic_anarchy
Content: We have two caches: a 2-way set-associative instruction cache and a direct-mapped data cache. We also have 4-way I-TLB and 4-way D-TLB MMU caches.

Author: logic_anarchy
Content: I can’t believe that 300k lines of Verilog generated by Yosys (thanx @Lofty) can actually work… that’s crazy.

Author: logic_anarchy
Content: @Leo Moser (mole99)  helped a lot with LibreLane, and his name is immortalized on the chip. Thanks, Leo Moser.
